security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. All described behaviors (image comparison, Claude API calls, file operations) are legitimate for visual accuracy validation. No obfuscation, no suspicious patterns, no credential theft or exfiltration.

content.user_title: Validate HTML visual accuracy against PDF source
content.value_statement: Manually comparing generated HTML to PDF source is slow and error-prone. This AI-powered skill provides automated visual validation with contextual understanding, scoring layout, hierarchy, and typography to ensure quality before deployment.
actual_capabilities: Compares rendered HTML screenshots against original PDF page images
Scores visual accuracy across four criteria: layout, hierarchy, positioning, typography
Provides contextual pass/fail decisions with 85% threshold
Generates detailed JSON reports with scoring rationale
Supports multi-page chapter validation with averaged scores
Blocks deployment pipeline on accuracy failures
limitations: Requires pre-rendered PNG images of both HTML and PDF for comparison
Cannot run without Claude API access and headless browser for rendering
Quality gate stops pipeline but does not automatically fix issues
Cannot compare complex interactive content or JavaScript-rendered elements

use_cases.title: Validate PDF-to-HTML conversion
use_cases.description: Ensure technical documentation maintains visual accuracy when converting from PDF to HTML format.

use_cases.title: Automated visual QA gate
use_cases.description: Integrate into CI/CD pipelines to automatically verify chapter content before publication.

use_cases.title: Compare design implementations
use_cases.description: Check if rendered HTML pages accurately match design mockups or source documents.

prompt_templates.title: Basic visual comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the original PDF page image to the rendered HTML screenshot. Score layout match, visual hierarchy, content positioning, and typography on 0-100 scale. Return JSON with overall score, criteria breakdown, and pass/fail recommendation at 85% threshold.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-page chapter check
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare this chapter across pages {start_page}-{end_page}. Score each page separately against its PDF source. Provide per-page scores and overall chapter assessment as JSON.

prompt_templates.title: Spot-check specific elements
prompt_templates.prompt: Focus on comparing heading hierarchy, table formatting, and figure placement between the PDF and rendered HTML. Score these three elements specifically and identify any issues that would confuse readers.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed visual report
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform comprehensive visual comparison. Return detailed JSON with: overall_score, threshold, recommendation, criteria_analysis (layout_match, visual_hierarchy, content_positioning, typography_styling), differences_noted array, visual_fidelity_assessment, confidence_level, explanation, and pass_fail_verdict.

output_examples.input: Compare chapter_05.html rendered against page_05.png from the original PDF
output: Layout Match: 94/100 - Page structure matches well

best_practices: Run the visual accuracy check as a blocking gate before deployment to catch issues early
Use high-resolution PNG screenshots for both HTML and PDF for accurate comparison
Review failed assessments to understand what differences the AI detected
Adjust the 85% threshold based on your quality requirements and acceptable variations
anti_patterns: Running visual accuracy checks on interactive pages with JavaScript-dependent content
Skipping the quality gate and deploying without visual validation
Ignoring failed checks without reviewing the detailed differences report
Using low-resolution screenshots that miss important visual details

faq.question: What AI models does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude 3.5 Sonnet and newer multi-modal models that support image input and structured JSON output.

faq.question: What happens if visual accuracy fails?
faq.answer: The pipeline stops with exit code 1. A detailed report shows which criteria failed and specific differences noted.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Configure as a blocking step. It returns exit code 0 for pass and 1 for fail, suitable for GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or similar.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Images are sent to Claude API for analysis. No data is stored or forwarded elsewhere. Check your API provider's privacy policy.

faq.question: Why does AI compare better than pixel-diff tools?
faq.answer: Pixel-diff tools flag everyÂæÆÂ∞è difference. AI understands context: web fonts can differ from PDF fonts but hierarchy remains correct. AI accepts valid variations.

faq.question: What image format and resolution are required?
faq.answer: Use PNG format at reasonable resolution (at least 1200px width). Full-page screenshots capture complete layout for accurate comparison.
